basics.name: Tomáš Dostál
basics.label: Software developer
basics.summary: Proficient and creative computer science student from the Czech Republic, yearning to do something great and meet amazing people. Currently in my second year at [FIT CTU, Prague](https://fit.cvut.cz/cs) in pursuit of getting a bachelor's degree in Informatics.  I believe that computers should make our lives easier and I'm doing my best for this idea to come true.   Automatization of processes to help people leave all that boring uncreative work to the computers is something I enjoy a lot. Skilled in creating interesting and interactive websites. Dedicated to superior customer service at all levels from the first meeting with a client to the website maintenance after launch. Detail-oriented and knowledgeable in various programming languages. The most comfortable for me is Python in the Unix ecosystem. Mainly focused on web-related solutions, finding the backend the most enjoyable. Recently started playing around with Raspberry PIs, K8S, docker, and network-related applications in general. Occasionally playing with my homemade clone of Prusa i3 MK2 3D printer or Arduinos. Fascinated in photography, 3D printing, and traveling. Chose IT in the hope not to be tightened by a fixed 9-5 schedule in an office. In the long-term seeking for the freedom to work from wherever I want, whenever I want.

work.summary: A fin-tech startup (one of few which avoid Haskell), which aims to make insurances and many other 'old-school businesses even easier. Paysure brings an innovative way how to limit payments by card by comprehensive criteria. All of that is done in language I prefer - Python
highlights: Strengthened my experiences with Python on the backend
Deep dive into Docker
Team of cool 'travel' people I enjoy working with
Finally a place where I can work full-remote. And go to the office when I want
Learned a bit o AWS here

work.summary: A fin-tech startup (one of few which avoid Haskell), which aims to make insurances and many other 'old-school businesses even easier. Paysure brings an innovative way how to limit payments by card by comprehensive criteria. All of that is done in language I prefer - Python
highlights: Strengthened my experiences with Python on the backend
Deep dive into Docker
Team of cool 'travel' people I enjoy working with
Finally a place where I can work full-remote. And go to the office when I want
Learned a bit o AWS here

work.summary: Custom website development. From an analysis of customer needs through development itself to deploying and maintaining sites. I am working with clients to solve problems or find solutions to requests, doing my best to stay within budget while still being able to provide clients with exactly what they want. Mostly working with clients having meaningful ideas. The reason for that is I want to leave behind something pleasant to the end-user, but also beneficial.
highlights: Broad experience in building WordPress CMS sites
Customize themes to meet clients’ requirements
Providing technical support to clients
Design new features for existing websites
SEO and analytics
Hosting services

work.position: Identification and improvement of QR code detection
work.summary: [Project DZO](https://www.pdzo.cz/) aims to examine the proposed methodology for decontamination of a large number of injured in pre-hospital care and to identify possible shortcomings. My job was to examine possibilities of identification of rescuers with 1-D or 2-D codes for further processing of the captured records.
Development of an automatic tool for bulk-transferring data to another information system.
Development of a medical data viewer „MedicalApp“, which aim was to simplify the process of getting and displaying data from medical facilities.
highlights: 4th place in category IT in the national round of Secondary Scholar Activity
Combining a wide range of languages (C#, Python, C++) and technologies (Unity3D, VTK, Google Drive, GTK3)

volunteer.summary: Founder of a COVID-19 regulations monitoring site [potrebujurousku.cz](https://www.potrebujurousku.cz/) ([github](https://github.com/tomas-dostal/potrebujurousku)) (ancestor of the official solution [covid.gov.cz](https://covid.gov.cz)) in the Czech Republic.
highlights: Several thousands of visitors
Project was nominated for Gratias Tibi price

Articles about the project in weekly papers '[Respekt](https://www.respekt.cz/agenda/nekdo-to-delat-musi-rika-spoluzakladatelka-webu-potrebuju-rousku-cz)' and '[DenikN](https://denikn.cz/495661/studenti-spustili-web-s-opatrenimi-proti-viru-driv-nez-vlada-pro-lidi-bylo-ubijejici-to-sledovat-vysvetluji)'
Replaced by an official government solution in about three months since published, so the idea of a COVID-19 regulations site was not that bad
Written in Django framework, Python
Scrapping content from the Ministry of Health using  BS4

volunteer.summary: Redesign of the website [domovenka.cz](domovenka.cz) and general support in the field of web analytics
highlights: Since I started supporting [domovenka.cz](domovenka.cz), the site raised more than 1.5 million CZK from donations

education.area: Database Design and Programming with SQL

skills.name: Tools/languages helping my day to be easier
